channel.title: 3D Render Request
channel.description:
If anyone would be so kind as to make me a Rubik's cube render, I would greatly appreciate it.
Example: http://fc06.deviantart.com/fs28/f/2008/054/9/0/Wallpaper__Rubiks_Cube___Ball_by_QOAL.png
I would use that image, but the silver ball is less than desirable and the resolution isn't high enough. The higher the resolution the better, 1600x1200 would be great. The background should either be transparent (png alpha), or a gradient grey like the example. It would be nice if the cube was scrambled (as is the example) but a solved one (presumably easier to make) would be fine too. I would do it myself, but I really have no skills whatsoever with Cinema4D or Blender.
Thanks :)
My crappy attempt (made with Google SketchUp and IRender nXt 2.0).
[img]http://jwarez.net/pics/a83ad2824c4becd2139c2e609e975499.png[/img]

item.title: 3D Render Request
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

SHIT I CHANGED THE CAMERA ANGLE ON ACCIDENT.
I had the PERFECTTTT light reflections on it. You can’t see them though because I moved the camera a little too far =[

Here’s another.

item.title: 3D Render Request
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Looking at my rubiks cube, theres some reflections of light and stuff. I think yours would look a little better if it was slightly more glossy, STH.

Also, yeah I love playing around with my macro lens to get closeups and stuff lol.

item.title: 3D Render Request
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Sorry for the shitty AA.
Seems to be a bug with the VRay engine. Increasing samples rams up rendertime with NO change at all. Weird.

And colors if they’re wrong. I’m colorblind lol, did the best I could.

Need any changes, lemme know. I’ll do it.

Read full topic
